articles.author: Aylin Woodward, Allison DeAngelis
articles.title: Intranasal COVID-19 vaccine spray could stem spread, researchers say - Business Insider
articles.description: A company called Altimmune is working on a nasal-spray version of a COVID-19 vaccine. The technology could stem the virus' spread better than shots.
articles.content:
It's an intuitive idea: Wouldn't it be best to administer a COVID-19 vaccine in the place it first invades the body?
